author: Jon Sindreu
title: Does Socially-Responsible Investment Pay Off?
text: Taking into account social and environmental criteria may promise a cleaner conscience when investing, but does it bring bigger returns? Maybe not, but it doesnâ€™t bring smaller returns either, suggests new data from U.S. bank Chase & Co., which track the performance of the debt of socially-responsible emerging-market issuers against more traditional benchmarks.
